abstract.p: A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described
A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: NEGOCIATION DE GROS BLOCS DE TITRES

abstract.p: Systems and methods for administering trade orders are described. An embodiment comprises receiving, from a first server operated by a first trader, a communication including a first trade order and one or more selection criteria, the first trade order including at least one of a specified instrument, a specified quantity, and a specified price
determining that a database of trade orders does not contain a trade order matching the first trade order
identifying a plurality of traders satisfying the selection criteria
sending, to a plurality of second servers, a query including at least one of the specified instrument, the specified quantity, and the specified price
receiving, from a one of the plurality of second servers operated on behalf of a second trader, a positive response to the query
and facilitating execution of a trade between the first trader and the second trader for the specified instrument at the specified price.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEMES DE NEGOCIATION ELECTRONIQUE ET PROCEDES DE NEGOCIATION

abstract.p: A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTÈMES DE NÉGOCIATION ÉLECTRONIQUE ET PROCÉDÉS DE NÉGOCIATION

nplcit.text: Statement in accordance with the Notice from the European Patent Office dated 1 October 2007 concerning business methods (OJ EPO 11/2007, 592-593): The claimed subject matter, with due regard to the description and drawings, relates to processes comprised in the list of subject matter and activities excluded from patentability under Art. 52(2) EPC, i.e. a non-technical scheme for order query identifying a firm order for a finacancial instrument. The applicant is advised that in accordance with the established practice of the EPO, no search need be performed in respect of those aspects of the claimed invention. The only identifiable technical aspects of the claimed invention relate to the use of conventional, general-purpose data processing technology for processing data of an inherently non-technical nature in order to automate the non-technical scheme. The information technology employed is considered to have been generally known as it was widely available to everyone at the date of filing/priority of the present application. The notoriety of such prior art cannot reasonably be contested. No documentary evidence was therefore considered required

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTÈMES DE NÉGOCIATION ÉLECTRONIQUE ET PROCÉDÉS DE NÉGOCIATION
NEGOCIATION DE GROS BLOCS DE TITRES

nplcit.text: Statement in accordance with the Notice from the European Patent Office dated 1 October 2007 concerning business methods (OJ EPO 11/2007, 592-593): The claimed subject matter, with due regard to the description and drawings, relates to processes comprised in the list of subject matter and activities excluded from patentability under Art. 52(2) EPC, i.e. a non-technical scheme for the administration of trade orders. The applicant is advised that in accordance with the established practice of the EPO, no search need be performed in respect of those aspects of the claimed invention. The only identifiable technical aspects of the claimed invention relate to the use of conventional, general-purpose data processing technology for processing data of an inherently non-technical nature in order to automate the non-technical scheme. The information technology employed is considered to have been generally known as it was widely available to everyone at the date of filing/priority of the present application. bibliographic-data.invention-title: NEGOCIATION DE GROS BLOCS DE TITRES
ELECTRONIC SECURITIES MARKETPLACE HAVING INTEGRATION WITH ORDER MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS

abstract.p: An electronic trading marketplace (ETM) communicates with interfacing modules interfacing directly with order management systems (OMS's) at trading institutions. The interfacing modules automatically transmit orders from the OMS databases to the ETM and update the OMS databases in response to orders executed at the ETM. Traders can communicate with the ETM to anonymously negotiate trades of securities.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: ELECTRONIC SECURITIES MARKETPLACE HAVING INTEGRATION WITH ORDER MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS

nplcit.text: - U.S. Appl. No. 12/015,990, filed Jan. 17, 2008; 80 Pages
- U.S. Appl. No. 12/113,642, filed May 1, 2008; 52 Pages

abstract.p: An electronic trading marketplace (ETM) communicates with interfacing modules interfacing directly with order management systems (OMS's) at trading institutions. The interfacing modules automatically transmit orders from the OMS databases to the ETM and update the OMS databases in response to orders executed at the ETM. Traders can communicate with the ETM to anonymously negotiate trades of securities.
A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

abstract.p: An electronic marketplace uses a fund composition to guide trading opportunities. Mutual funds typically have a target composition of financial instruments. When prices change for constituents of such a mutual fund, the fund typically needs to rebalance in order to maintain a desired composition. A marketplace that understands the target composition and the movement in prices targets trading opportunities to a fund in a more tailored manner than a traditional marketplace.

abstract.p: A trading platform and trading method that permit calculation of a price is described. Other embodiments are also described.

Systems and methods for administering trade orders are described. An embodiment comprises receiving, from a first server operated by a first trader, a communication including a first trade order and one or more selection criteria, the first trade order including at least one of a specified instrument, a specified quantity, and a specified price
determining that a database of trade orders does not contain a trade order matching the first trade order
identifying a plurality of traders satisfying the selection criteria
sending, to a plurality of second servers, a query including at least one of the specified instrument, the specified quantity, and the specified price
receiving, from a one of the plurality of second servers operated on behalf of a second trader, a positive response to the query
and facilitating execution of a trade between the first trader and the second trader for the specified instrument at the specified price.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multicomputer distributed processing of large block trading data

abstract.p: Systems and methods for administering trade orders are described. An embodiment comprises receiving, from a first server operated by a first trader, a communication including a first trade order and one or more selection criteria, the first trade order including at least one of a specified instrument, a specified quantity, and a specified price
determining that a database of trade orders does not contain a trade order matching the first trade order
identifying a plurality of traders satisfying the selection criteria
sending, to a plurality of second servers, a query including at least one of the specified instrument, the specified quantity, and the specified price
receiving, from a one of the plurality of second servers operated on behalf of a second trader, a positive response to the query
and facilitating execution of a trade between the first trader and the second trader for the specified instrument at the specified price.
A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

abstract.p: A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.
A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.
A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

An electronic marketplace uses a fund composition to guide trading opportunities. Mutual funds typically have a target composition of financial instruments. When prices change for constituents of such a mutual fund, the fund typically needs to rebalance in order to maintain a desired composition. A marketplace that understands the target composition and the movement in prices targets trading opportunities to a fund in a more tailored manner than a traditional marketplace.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: NEGOCIATION DE GROS BLOCS DE TITRES

abstract.p: Systems and methods for administering trade orders are described. An embodiment comprises receiving, from a first server operated by a first trader, a communication including a first trade order and one or more selection criteria, the first trade order including at least one of a specified instrument, a specified quantity, and a specified price
determining that a database of trade orders does not contain a trade order matching the first trade order
identifying a plurality of traders satisfying the selection criteria
sending, to a plurality of second servers, a query including at least one of the specified instrument, the specified quantity, and the specified price
receiving, from a one of the plurality of second servers operated on behalf of a second trader, a positive response to the query
and facilitating execution of a trade between the first trader and the second trader for the specified instrument at the specified price.

L'invention concerne des systèmes et des procédés de gestion d'ordres de transaction. Un mode de réalisation consiste : à recevoir, d'un premier serveur exploité par un premier négociateur, une communication contenant un premier ordre de transaction et au moins un critère de sélection, le premier ordre de transaction contenant au moins un titre déterminé, une quantité déterminée ou un prix déterminé
à déterminer qu'une base de données d'ordres de transaction ne contient pas d'ordre de transaction correspondant à ce premier ordre de transaction
à identifier une pluralité de négociateurs répondant aux critères de sélection
à envoyer à une pluralité de deuxièmes serveurs une requête contenant au moins le titre déterminé, la quantité déterminée ou le prix déterminé
à recevoir, d'un deuxième serveur de la pluralité de serveurs exploités au nom d'un deuxième négociateur, une réponse positive à la requête
et à faciliter l'exécution d'une transaction entre le premier négociateur et le deuxième négociateur pour le titre déterminé au prix déterminé.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: NEGOCIATION DE GROS BLOCS DE TITRES

determining that a database of trade orders does not contain a trade order matching the first trade order
identifying a plurality of traders satisfying the selection criteria
sending, to a plurality of second servers, a query including at least one of the specified instrument, the specified quantity, and the specified price
receiving, from a one of the plurality of second servers operated on behalf of a second trader, a positive response to the query
and facilitating execution of a trade between the first trader and the second trader for the specified instrument at the specified price.

L'invention concerne des systèmes et des procédés de gestion d'ordres de transaction. Un mode de réalisation consiste : à recevoir, d'un premier serveur exploité par un premier négociateur, une communication contenant un premier ordre de transaction et au moins un critère de sélection, le premier ordre de transaction contenant au moins un titre déterminé, une quantité déterminée ou un prix déterminé
à déterminer qu'une base de données d'ordres de transaction ne contient pas d'ordre de transaction correspondant à ce premier ordre de transaction
à identifier une pluralité de négociateurs répondant aux critères de sélection
à envoyer à une pluralité de deuxièmes serveurs une requête contenant au moins le titre déterminé, la quantité déterminée ou le prix déterminé
à recevoir, d'un deuxième serveur de la pluralité de serveurs exploités au nom d'un deuxième négociateur, une réponse positive à la requête
et à faciliter l'exécution d'une transaction entre le premier négociateur et le deuxième négociateur pour le titre déterminé au prix déterminé.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTÈMES DE NÉGOCIATION ÉLECTRONIQUE ET PROCÉDÉS DE NÉGOCIATION

abstract.p: A trading platform and trading method that allows access to additional pools of liquidity is described. Other embodiments are also described.

L'invention concerne une plate-forme de négociation et un procédé de négociation qui permettent d'accéder à des pools de liquidité supplémentaires. D'autres modes de réalisation sont également décrits.
